required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A New Etiological Cause for Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injury: E-Scooter
clinical_study.official_title: A New Etiological Cause for Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injury: E-Scooter

lead_sponsor.agency: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

clinical_study.source: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to find the relationship between e-scooter use and anterior cruciate ligament injury.

detailed_description.textblock: The incidence of injuries related to e-scooter use is increasing. There is no study in the literature investigating the relationship between anterior cruciate ligament injury and e-scooter use.

primary_outcome.description: The investigators evaluated medical report of ACL injuried patients retrospectively

study_pop.textblock: Patients with e-scooter related ACL injury between January 2019-June 2021

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with e-scooter related ACL injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with other ACL injury etiology

facility.name: SBU Prof. Cemil Tascioglu City Hospital
